programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cardinal begin their ACC era by squaring off against the Orange for the first time. Syracuse quarterback Kyle McCord threw for at least 350 yards and four TDs in both wins this year, including a Sept. 7 decision against then-No. 23 Georgia Tech.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Desert Diamond Arena in Glendale, Ariz.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of Saturday's biggest games, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit, Desmond Howard, Pat McAfee, and Nick Saban cover college football with pregame breakdowns, exclusive interviews, features and predictions.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: For just the second time in 15 years, Florida travels to play Mississippi State. Gators head coach Billy Napier finds himself on the hot seat amidst a 1-2 start for his squad. Kevin Coleman Jr. (MSST) has a touchdown catch in all three games in 2024.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers (2-1) and Razorbacks (2-1) kick off their SEC campaigns at Jordan-Hare Stadium. Auburn has won seven of the last eight meetings after a 48-10 triumph in 2023. Ja'Quinden Jackson (ARK) has rushed for 397 yards and six touchdowns in 2024.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Sunshine State programs come together for the first time since 2013 as the No. 8 Hurricanes (3-0) visit the Bulls (2-1) in Week 4. Miami has outscored its opponents 159-26 this season en route to earning its highest national ranking since 2020.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars clash with the Wildcats. BYU is 3-0 for the second straight year after winning at Wyoming on Sept. 14. Kansas State comes off a statement 31-7 victory at then-No. 20 Arizona. BYU went 2-7 during its first season in the Big 12 in 2023.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Sunshine State programs come together for the first time since 2013 as the No. 8 Hurricanes (3-0) visit the Bulls (2-1) in Week 4. Miami has outscored its opponents 159-26 this season en route to earning its highest national ranking since 2020.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers contest the Singapore Grand Prix. Oscar Piastri's Sept. 15 win helped McLaren to the Constructors' Championship lead. Carlos Sainz Jr. and Sergio Pérez, who collided late in the Azerbaijan GP, won the last two races in Singapore.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Liberty begin the WNBA postseason by welcoming the No. 8 Dream to the Big Apple for Game 1 of their first-round series. On Sept. 19, Atlanta defeated New York 78-67 to nail down a playoff spot and snap a five-game skid against the Liberty.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The second-seeded Lynx host the seventh-seeded Mercury in Game 1 of their first-round set. Minnesota was 3-1 versus Phoenix in the regular season and won both dates at home. Napheesa Collier (MIN) averaged 17.3 points per game versus Phoenix in 2024.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Ace right-hander Zack Wheeler and the Phillies visit the Mets. Wheeler (16-6, 2.56 ERA, 0.95 WHIP) has won four straight starts, yielding four runs with 29 strikeouts in 26 innings during that span. He has yet to face his former team in 2024.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Aces and No. 5 Storm kick off their first-round series in the WNBA playoffs with Game 1. Las Vegas defeated Seattle 85-72 on Sept. 17 to clinch home-court advantage. A'ja Wilson (LVA) set the WNBA record for most rebounds in a season.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: Monday Night Kickoff
programme.desc: The legendary Monday Night Football crew of Joe Buck, Troy Aikman, and Lisa Salters preview the upcoming Monday Night Football action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Bills host the Jaguars in the first of two contests on the Monday night slate. Buffalo scored the most points of any AFC club through two weeks, with Josh Allen having a part in five touchdowns. Jacksonville beat Buffalo 25-20 in England in 2023.

programme.title: High School Football
programme.desc: From Major Brown Memorial Stadium in Birmingham, Ala.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: The Season: Ole Miss Football
programme.desc: The stories of Rebel student-athletes, coaches and staff portray who they are as people.

programme.title: The Path: LSU Football
programme.desc: An in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the LSU football team's season.

programme.title: The Pulse: Texas A&M Football
programme.desc: "The Pulse: Texas A&M Football" is an all-access pass to Mike Elko and the Aggies team, all from the comfort of your living room. The 12th Man Productions team takes you behind the scenes of Aggie football -- from the hard work put in on the practice fields and in-game emotions to locker room speeches and off-the-field fun. "The Pulse" walks you through the week-by-week lives of the Aggie football players. The 30-minute show premieres every game week throughout the season. Elko and his staff embrace the grind as they prepare for another season in the SEC.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: One More Round: Taylor vs. Teofimo
programme.desc: Another look at the Josh Taylor vs. Teofimo Lopez title fight from Madison Square Garden.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Third free practice of round 18 of the 2024 Formula One World Championship, the Singapore Grand Prix at Marina Bay Street Circuit in Singapore, Singapore.

programme.title: Sport Fishing Television
programme.desc: Taking a look back at the best moments from SFTV's 2024 season.

programme.title: The Good Exchange: Keyshawn Davis x Shu Shu Carrington
programme.desc: Hosts Keyshawn Davis and Shu Shu Carrington discuss the latest boxing news.

programme.title: Ryan vs. Mayer: Ultimate Betrayal
programme.desc: Sandy Ryan takes on Mikaela Mayer in the main event for the WBO World Female Welterweight Title. From Madison Square Garden in New York.

programme.title: One More Round: Taylor vs. Teofimo
programme.desc: Another look at the Josh Taylor vs. Teofimo Lopez title fight from Madison Square Garden.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Qualifying of round 18 of the 2024 Formula One World Championship, the Singapore Grand Prix at Marina Bay Street Circuit in Singapore, Singapore.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Jayhawks (1-2) line up against the Mountaineers (1-2). In 2022, Kansas achieved an ultra-rare 13-point overtime victory with a walk-off 86-yard pick-six from Cobee Bryant. Kansas running back Devin Neal scored three times in that contest.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 19 Cardinals clash with the Yellow Jackets. Georgia Tech improved to 3-1 behind Haynes King's three TD passes in a 59-7 rout of VMI on Sept. 14. Louisville went 7-1 in ACC play last season, but fell to Florida State in the championship game.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Bears take on the Seminoles. California has surprised with a 3-0 record thus far, while Florida State, the preseason ACC favorite, has stumbled to a shocking 0-3 start. Cal freshman Nyziah Hunter has scored four times in three games.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: Women's College Volleyball
programme.desc: From Maples Pavilion in Stanford, Calif.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Gotham FC (12-4-4) get their first look at the expansion Royals (4-13-3). Gotham recently added Ali Krieger to the management team as a club ambassador. Krieger tallied 108 caps for the U.S. national team and helped Gotham win the NWSL title in 2023.

programme.title: USL Championship Soccer
programme.desc: From Keyworth Stadium in Hamtramck, Mich.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Domonique Foxworth shares his take on current sports events and participants.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Following all the action from the world of horse racing.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Joy Taylor, Keyshawn Johnson and Paul Pierce dive into the biggest sports topics of the day with insight and experience.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 24 Fighting Illini take on the No. 22 Cornhuskers. Illinois is off to its first 3-0 start since 2011, while Nebraska also has its first 3-0 mark since 2016. The Huskers ended a three-game slide against the Illini with a 20-7 verdict in 2023.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: Host Charissa Thompson sits down with Bucs linebacker Lavonte David; a day in the life of Jaguars executive and AEW Owner, Tony Khan; First Impressions of 2024.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the season news and highlights with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: Nine Lucas Oil Series classes compete for the drive to the championship at over 60 events nationally to culminate in a world championship in Pomona, California.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: From Bristol Motor Speedway in Bristol, Tenn.

programme.title: MotoAmerica Rewind
programme.desc: Replays of motorcycle road racing action in North America.

programme.title: MotoAmerica King of the Baggers Rewind
programme.desc: MotoAmerica presents Mission King of the Baggers. Watch the Harley and Indian V-Twins go head to head to crown the King of the Baggers.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: Top college football games from the Big 12, Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences, beginning each Saturday with the brand-new Big Noon Kickoff pregame show on Fox.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bearcats host the Cougars. Cincinnati rides high after knocking off Miami (Ohio) 27-16 to capture the Victory Bell. Houston beat Rice in the Bayou Bucket Classic. Cincinnati edged past Houston 24-14 for a fourth straight series victory in 2023.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Sun Devils visit the Red Raiders. First-year Big 12 member Arizona State is 3-0 for the first time since 2019. Texas Tech's Tahj Brooks moved into ninth place in program history with his 30th career rushing TD in a 66-21 win over North Texas.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wildcats go head-to-head with a new conference foe in the Huskies. Chicago native Jack Lausch replaced Mike Wright at quarterback and led Northwestern past Eastern Illinois 31-7 on Sept. 14. Washington fell to Washington State in the Apple Cup.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Broncos (1-1) ride high into this matchup against the Vikings (0-2). Boise State went into its bye week with a near-upset of then-No. 7 Oregon on Sept. 7, and comes out of the break as one of four new admissions to the revamped Pac-12 Conference.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Thundering Herd and No. 3 Buckeyes return from their bye weeks with a game at Ohio Stadium. Ohio State has outscored opponents 108-6 across two victories in 2024. Will Howard (OSU) had four TD passes, three to Jeremiah Smith, in those games.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 12 Utes introduce themselves to the No. 14 Cowboys. Both sides are 3-0. Entering Week 4, Oklahoma State's Alan Bowman ranked sixth nationally with 967 passing yards to go with eight TD throws. Utah won the Battle of the Brothers on Sept. 14.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the season news and highlights with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Shedeur Sanders and the Buffaloes look to keep rolling in their first Big 12 outing as they host the Bears. Sanders threw for four TDs to lead Colorado to a 28-9 win over Colorado State in the Rocky Mountain Showdown. The schools last met in 2010.

programme.desc: In the fastest motorsport on earth, things don't always go as planned; relive the NHRA moments that grabbed our attention and see how they walked away.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From Oct. 26, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo had 35 points and 10 assists, Damian Lillard added 28 points, and the Milwaukee Bucks beat the New York Knicks, 146-122, on Tuesday night to reach the semifinals of the NBA's inaugural In-Season Tournament. From Dec. 5, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo had 32 points and 12 rebounds to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 133-129 victory over the Chicago Bulls in overtime. DeMar DeRozan had 41 points and Coby White scored 33 for Chicago, which had won four straight.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored a franchise-record 64 points to help the Milwaukee Bucks outscore the Indiana Pacers 140-126, with Antetokounmpo then at the center of a post-game confrontation over the game ball. From Dec. 13, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Damian Lillard swished a 3-pointer at the buzzer in overtime to give the Milwaukee Bucks a stunning 143-142 win over the Sacramento Kings. From Jan. 14, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo had 33 points and 13 rebounds to help the Milwaukee Bucks surge out of the All-Star break with a 112-107 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves. From Feb. 23, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Damian Lillard scored 41 points as the Milwaukee Bucks came from behind to beat the Los Angeles Clippers 113-106 for their sixth straight victory since the All-Star break. From March 4, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From Oct. 26, 2023.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Liberty begin the WNBA postseason by welcoming the No. 8 Dream to the Big Apple for Game 1 of their first-round series. On Sept. 19, Atlanta defeated New York 78-67 to nail down a playoff spot and snap a five-game skid against the Liberty.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 3 Sun and No. 6 Fever contest Game 1 of a first-round set. Indiana snapped an 11-game skid versus Connecticut on Aug. 28, and is in the postseason for the first time since 2016. That is also the last year the Fever won in the Nutmeg State.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The second-seeded Lynx host the seventh-seeded Mercury in Game 1 of their first-round set. Minnesota was 3-1 versus Phoenix in the regular season and won both dates at home. Napheesa Collier (MIN) averaged 17.3 points per game versus Phoenix in 2024.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Aces and No. 5 Storm kick off their first-round series in the WNBA playoffs with Game 1. Las Vegas defeated Seattle 85-72 on Sept. 17 to clinch home-court advantage. A'ja Wilson (LVA) set the WNBA record for most rebounds in a season.
